content.description: Start down really low on crimpy ledge work your way over on small jugs then huge crux move to sloper the hard part is trying not to cut feet or you hit the ground then another big move to ledge and top out
content.location: Small overhang to the left of the green mile

content.description: Start just to the right midsummers night dyno lower in the roof. Traverse to the right then out over the roof then traversing left to link up to the top half of midsummers nigh dyno

Cool little arete climb with a seemingly-sketchy fall, but pretty safe if you stay on the arete and right face.

 Starting on the obvious ledge under the mini roof, bump up on adequate jugs and sidepulls and get your feet over the roof (crux). Hug the arete, take a seat and rest a little. Pull up using a slopey crimp and a optional mono, then shoot for the horn and top out. To achieve the grade, use high starting feet; stay off of the mossy lower block (see pic).  Most importantly however, enjoy the outdoors.
content.protection: One pad works.  If you stay off the left face, the landing is decent.
content.location: In the same little cove as Spring Green and Season Killer. Park at the first lot and hike down the upper trail about 100' past the vehicle gate. Walk along the edge until you see the cove, with a huge overhang and a large dead tree stump. The best approach at this point is to go back left and scramble down, and then around to the right through the little pass. Spookier than Soup is the sharp arete past the overhang.

content.description: Sit start the left corner of the overhang. This is the crux. Pull up on small right ledge and tiny left crimp just above your head. Large bump up to gain first legde. Pull up and grab sloper with left hand.  Move feet to get ready for huge move to gain main overhang. There are a few ways to continue. Once over the overhang, it's pretty easy moving to the top.
content.location: When you head into the park, pass the rangers house, and park at first lot on left side. Walk right into the woods. Continue right until you see small wooden bridge. Look for the cove with a dead tree half cut down. Pic provided.

content.description: Variation of Bobby's world instead of going right to the pebble you go left to a crack and under cling and bump up crimps to pocket and top out
content.location: To the left of Bobby's world starts on the same holds

content.description: Pronounced "min-eh-strone-ee," this route starts on a decent pair of ledges, swoops left, and climbs straight up the face while staying off the right arete. Fairly sustained throughout on smaller holds, better quality rock than the surrounding area. Leave the bird's nest where it be.
content.protection: One pad works, but you may want two to help cover the rock at the base.
content.location: Park at the first lot and walk down the upper trail until the vehicle gate is on your right. At this point, head left towards the ledges and you should see a wooden post sunk down into a slight valley. Go down the rocky staircase with the wooden railing until you come out into an open area - you'll be looking right at it.

content.description: Traverse from the corner of the boulder across from Bobby's world, to about five feet from the left corner and top out
content.location: Directly across from Bobby's world and muscle up  take first right when entering the park and park in the first small parking area on left head straight into the woods and you will see the first bouldering area this is the obvious large block

content.description: Start on rail in the back then dyno to big jug over the roof caution: super dabby feet. Use the crack systems to the right going up then to the two finger pocket bumping up to the flake. After that top out.
content.location: Just to the right of "season killer"

content.description: The climb is pretty straight-forward. There are a half-dozen obvious holds. The crux of the problem is reaching for and getting past the big reach up to a crack on the overhang.
content.location: On the North side of the 'bouldering area,' North nearly all the way to the main stretch of enscarpment (scenic overlook). The problem is on the Westernmost wall, with only hillside to the West, and the rest of the 'bouldering area' to the East and South.

content.description: Start on crappy pinch and crimp up to good jugs then crux move to a one and a half finger pebble with left hand then up to sloper with right top out on obvious crimpers
content.location: From the first parking lot basically straight in and it will be directly beneath you

content.description:
This area contains mostly average-quality rock with a few gems sprinkled throughout a maze of ledges and pillars.  The Green Mile and Midsummer's Night Dyno stand out among the choss.  Plenty of easier problems to climb here, with possibilities for new routes after some cleaning.

 You will encounter people here (rather, they will encounter you) who may not understand why your hands are white and what that brightly-colored slab is on the ground beneath you.  Just smile and be friendly, and be conscious of small children running around in front of your spotter.  The weekdays are less busy, but it's fairly rare to be the only car parked in this lot.
